page.title: 14CLEETHORPES PIER
page.content: In August 1985, Cleethorpes pier appears to have a new lease of life. Built by a group of local businessmen and the Manchester,Sheffield and Lincolnshire Railway Company, the pier opened on August Bank Holiday 1873. Despite a fire in 1903, and a hole blown in it to thwart a possible German invasion in 1940, the pier remained an important centre for entertainment until recent loss making years. The Cleethorpes Council, which had bought the pier in 1935,sold it to a private company in 1981.However, it failed to make a profit and was closed.Several attempts were made to sell the pier and finally it was sold to a London based company. Since the sale the pier has been extensively renovated with bars, dance floors,a restaurant and games room.Hopefully the pier will regain its popularity.
